description: A mobile phone store manager in Simferopol stole 19 phones worth half a million to pay for vision correction and buy glasses. He sold the phones to a pawnshop, but was caught when his boss discovered dummies in boxes from a new batch.
original:
The manager of a mobile phone store from Simferopol stole half a million worth of phones to pay for vision correction and buy glasses, writes Mash

Sergei (pictured) got a job as a salesman in a store, rose in position, but still did not have enough money to pay off the loan and the operation. The employee saw nothing wrong with having his vision fixed at the employer’s expense.

19 phones were moved to a pawnshop, Sergei received 500 thousand, later he wanted to buy everything back, but did not have time. His boss discovered dummies in boxes from a new batch. The manager received a one and a half year probation and returned everything stolen.

I'm not crazy

description: Soviet dissident Alexander Skobov, 66, was detained at a human rights activist's home in St. Petersburg. He was accused of publicly justifying terrorism under Article 205.2 of the Russian Criminal Code. Skobov was not allowed to take his diabetes medications and intends to refuse a lawyer. The detention may be related to his posts about the SVO.
original:
Forwarded from: Caution, news
Soviet dissident Alexander Skobov was detained in St. Petersburg. 66-year-old Skobov was detained at the home of human rights activist Yuli Rybakova, Rybakov’s wife Ekaterina Molostvova reported this on her Facebook page*. Fontanka, citing Rybakov, claims that we are talking about a criminal case under Article 205.2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Public justification of terrorism.” The human rights activist said that Skobov was detained without allowing him to pick up his diabetes medications. It is unknown which publications the detention is connected with. “Rotunda” writes that we can talk about posts about the SVO; Skobov’s associates also told the project that he intends to refuse a lawyer.

In 1978, Skobov was placed by a court in a psychiatric hospital for actions calling for the overthrow of the tyranny of officials; he was released in 1981. After that, he was detained several more times, sent for compulsory treatment for actions, and in 1988 he became a defendant in the last case under the article “anti-Soviet agitation” (in 1989, due to a change in the wording of the article, it was closed). During the wars in Chechnya, Skobov was a participant in the anti-war movement, and until 2010 he was a member of the Yabloko party. He openly opposed the fighting in Ukraine.

description: Drone training emphasizes safety protocols for operators, highlighting the dangers of enemy drones and the importance of following life-saving rules to avoid detonation. These rules include not touching or approaching a fallen drone, destroying it remotely if possible, and exercising caution when dealing with unknown drones.
original:
VideoVideo taken from grunters.

When training operators, we pay a lot of attention to safety. Graduates know the dangers, know the principles and sequence of actions.

But it’s not just pilots or bomb operators who need drone training.

Every day there are more and more drones in the sky. Ours. Enemy.

Thousands of minds on both sides of the front are thinking around the clock about more effectively defeating enemy personnel.
New options for initiating detonation are being developed. And tricks are used and traps are set.
Drones didn’t just bring the war of the future with their whirring propellers. Drones are constantly evolving. And at this time, it is especially important that every fighter knows simple life-saving rules:
There's a drone, a store, a radio station lying around - don't grab it.
A drone fell nearby - don’t think you’re safe; move away.
Is there a possibility? Destroy it remotely. But under no circumstances touch it, don’t push it with a stick, don’t throw anything close.

An enemy drone may explode:
When falling,
When you try to disconnect,
When the timer expires,
When changing the frame tilt,
When the battery charge runs out.

You can even bring a drone that hasn’t exploded into the dugout, take pictures with it and send the photo to your grandmother via WhatsApp, as many people like. And it, seemingly harmless, will explode in 5 minutes. If it doesn't explode, WhatsApp will help.

Professional: will figure out the situation without advice.
Inexperienced: stand back and/or shoot from a distance.

P.S. No negative comments about the soldier who gave his life in this war. Most of those who “I would if I were him...” were not in his place. But they may turn out to be. Study. Practice. Get ready."Flock. Same blood"

description: A Russian missile strike hit the Dnipro, damaging buildings of a college and kindergarten. Rescue operations are underway, with all services on site. Ukrainian President Zelenskiy thanked first responders and emphasized the importance of air defense systems to protect lives from Russian terror.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Rescue operations are currently underway in the Dnipro after a Russian missile strike. In particular, the buildings of the college and kindergarten were damaged. All services are on site. And I thank all the first responders who go to the places of impact to help people as quickly as possible. This is the most important thing.

It is equally important that Russian terrorists receive answers to their attacks. More far-reaching answers each time. Thank you to each of our soldiers, to all Ukrainian men and women who ensure this. The Russian system of war, everyone who is involved in this aggression - all of them must really feel that the aggression will not go away just like that. Evil must lose. And will lose. And I emphasize again: air defense for Ukraine is the protection of life, this is what should work, the air defense systems that exist in the world cannot simply gather dust somewhere on the bases, when they can save thousands of lives from Russian terror.

I thank everyone who helps Ukraine! Thank you to everyone who protects life, our state, our independence! Thanks to our soldiers! Thanks to everyone who is holding his ground and destroying the occupier. We must win.
Glory to Ukraine!

description: A storm in the Kyiv region caused damage to roofs and power lines, with 30 reports of destruction recorded. The affected areas include Buchansk, Bilotserkiv, Vyshhorod, Obukhiv, and Boryspil districts. No casualties were reported, but 42 10 kV lines were disconnected.
original:
‼️Ruslan Kravchenko: A storm in Kyiv region caused damage to roofs and an accident in networks⚡️💨 In Kyiv region, as a result of the storm, a number of cases of the destruction of roofs in buildings and falling trees were recorded in 5 districts of the region. In particular, in Buchansk, Bilotserkiv, Vyshhorod, Obukhiv and Boryspil districts.

As of 20:00, there were no reports of casualties as a result of worsening weather conditions.

Almost 30 reports of damage have already been recorded. It is about the destruction of the roofs of a number of private houses, social institutions, one of the enterprises, garages, as well as the fall of trees and fences on power lines, cars, highways, etc.

According to energy experts, bad weather caused accidents in networks. 42 10 kV lines were disconnected. Bilotserkivskyi, Boryspilskyi, Buchanskyi, Fastivskyi and Obukhivskyi districts were affected by the elements. The consequences of bad weather are promptly eliminated.

All operative services work in enhanced mode. People are given all the help they need.

description: In 2022, the draft age was limited to 27 years due to the demographic hole in Eastern Europe, where the gender and age pyramid thins out sharply between 20 and 27 years old. This age group is critical for demographics and socio-economics, as they are the most active and qualified part of the population, driving the economy and public life.
original:
Forwarded from: alcoholic historian
In general, it is clear why in 2022 the draft was limited to a lower limit of 27 years.

It is precisely at this point and up to the age of 20 that the gender and age pyramid sharply thins out - children of the demographic hole common to Eastern Europe.

Therefore, large military losses in this generation are most critical from the point of view of demographics and generally from a socio-economic point of view: there will simply be a failure, first among 30-year-olds, and then among 40-year-old men - the most active and qualified part of the population - the engines of the economy and public life countries.

At the same time, of course, they were not allowed to leave - they were kept as an emergency reserve.

And now they broke off a piece from this reserve - they broke off a serious piece of the future. That is, everything is completely bad.

event: Gennady Zyuganov's Statement on Decisive Measures
description: Gennady Zyuganov, leader of the Communist Party of Russia, emphasized the need for decisive measures in response to Ukrainian UAV strikes on Tatarstan. He advocated for studying the experience of past victorious wars, including the civil war and World War II, to develop effective countermeasures against terrorist attacks.
original:
The leader of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Gennady Zyuganov believes that after the strike of Ukrainian UAVs on Tatarstan, the time has come for decisive measures

“War has its own laws, and if you don’t forestall events, there will definitely be trouble. We need to fight the war in a real way. I want the experience of our victorious war to be studied, starting from the civil war, when we defeated the Entente and their White Guard minions. By the way, during the Second World War, when the Nazis were 30 km from the capital, there was not a single terrorist attack in Moscow.
And now we need to take measures that will paralyze this possibility. In my opinion, not enough such measures have been taken so far. As for a more effective fight, we know well and let’s accept them.” https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301722VK VideoVideo by Self-Defense of GorlovkaWatch Video by Self-Defense of Gorlovka 57 s from 2 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! description: Russia has begun producing the FAB-3000 bomb, one of the most powerful in the world, with an explosive force equivalent to 44 tons of TNT. Its destructive power is comparable to tactical nuclear weapons, capable of destroying all living things within a 35-meter radius.
original:
Forwarded from: The world of Mikhail Onufrienko
The weight of the FAB-3000 bomb reaches three tons, and it contains as much as 1,400 kilograms of explosives, providing a total explosion force of 44 tons of TNT equivalent. This makes this ammunition one of the most powerful in the world, comparable even to tactical nuclear weapons.

The ability of the FAB-3000 to destroy all living things within a radius of 35 meters during an explosion amazes the imagination with its destructive power.

The puppies are panicking: “The worst has come... They started producing FAB-250, FAB-500, and now FAB-3000. It itself completely destroys all fortified areas. One and a half tons of explosives is like... If it hits someone, the person decomposes into molecules. If anyone is nearby, at least two or three kilometers away, their eardrums burst. And fear, panic. This is the most dangerous thing there is. This thing is very serious. Moreover, such weapons are permitted by all conventions.”

description: The FSB, in collaboration with the Federal Customs Service, intercepted a shipment of explosives from Ukraine, disguised as Orthodox icons and church utensils. The cargo, which included 27 improvised explosive devices, 70 kg of high-power plastic explosive, 91 electric detonators, and RPG-7 grenade launcher parts, was seized at the Ubylinka international automobile checkpoint in the Pskov region.
original:
The FSB stopped the import of a consignment of explosives from the territory of Ukraine. FSB operatives, together with the Federal Customs Service, opened and disrupted the supply route of explosives that were imported into Russian territory in icons.

27 improvised explosive devices, 70 kg of high-power plastic explosive, 91 electric detonators, as well as parts of shots for an RPG-7 grenade launcher were recovered from the cargo. “During the inspection of a car by Russian FSB officers at the international automobile checkpoint "Ubylinka" (Pskov region, Latvian -Russian section of the state border) foreign-made explosives were found in a shipment of Orthodox icons and church utensils imported into the Russian Federation from Ukraine,” the FSB reported.

The cargo was transported along the route Ukraine – Romania – Hungary – Slovakia – Poland – Lithuania – Latvia – Russia.

The FSB noted that all those involved in the incident will be identified and prosecuted.@anna_news

description: Streamer Nelly Khomyachkova was fined 30,000 rubles for discrediting the Russian army. During a broadcast, she referred to Russian soldiers as 'cannon fodder' and suggested declaring peace with America and Ukraine.
original:
The Bataysk streamer, who called Russian soldiers “cannon fodder,” was fined 30 thousand rubles under the article on discrediting the army. On March 21, 23-year-old streamer Nelly Khomyachkova (Stefan) conducted a broadcast on the social network “Friend Around” in which she called Russian soldiers “* *another cannon fodder,” and proposed declaring peace with America and Ukraine.

Z-bloggers and local publics drew attention to fragments of the stream, the streamer was detained, and her statements were checked by the Investigative Committee. As a result, the police drew up two reports against her - on the demonstration of extremist symbols (20.3 of the Administrative Code) and discrediting the army (20.3.3 of the Administrative Code). According to the second protocol, she was fined 30 thousand rubles.

description: Despite regular shelling by Ukrainian Armed Forces, the Novokakhovskaya central city hospital continues to operate, providing emergency medical care, specialized examinations, and necessary tests to patients. The hospital has 30 doctors, including 12 highly specialized specialists, and has formed three mobile teams to assist with emergency medical aid.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Health of Kherson region
About 30 doctors work in the Novokakhovskaya hospital - help is provided to everyone who needs it. The Novokakhovskaya central city hospital, despite regular shelling of the city and the medical facility itself by militants of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, operates as usual.

Patients receive emergency medical care, are examined by highly specialized specialists and can take all the necessary tests.

For example, two gynecologists at the Novokakhovskaya Hospital see 20-30 women a day. Obstetrician-gynecologist Rita Krutienko has been working at the medical institution for more than 30 years.💬“Women come to us every day, including pregnant women. We register them,” said Rita Krutienko.

Since the beginning of the year, psychological assistance has also been provided at the Novokakhovskaya hospital. They turn to a specialized specialist with various questions, and not only pregnant women. 💬 “Adults, the elderly, who have no housing, no children nearby. They need to be reassured,” says Elena Kuzmina, a psychologist at the Novokakhovskaya Central City Hospital.

In addition, the only psychologist in the region also conducts group work with employees of the medical institution - improves the psychological climate and restores calm, eliminates the consequences of stressful experiences. In total, the hospital employs 29 specialists, 12 of whom are highly specialized. Also, the medical institution has formed three mobile teams to assist the emergency station medical assistance - calls are sent to a hotline. Doctors provide assistance either at home or send them to a hospital. The medical facility is equipped with everything necessary - medicines and equipment.💬“The supply of medicines is regular. In the near future, we will have new laboratory equipment,” noted the chief physician of the Novokakhovskaya Central City Hospital, Ekaterina Gribovskaya. According to the head of the regional Ministry of Health, Artysh Sat, strengthening the material and technical base of the region’s medical institutions will continue - in the near future, an operating unit will be opened in the Novokakhovskaya hospital. Video source: VKontakte |Odnoklassniki

#Ministry of Health_Kherson_Russia

description: The Ministry of Defense's propaganda train, 'Strength in Truth', arrived in Vladivostok after traveling through dozens of Russian regions. The train features a concert platform, exhibition cars showcasing the history of the armed forces, and a thematic exhibition on Ukraine's leadership plans and Nazi ideology.
original:
Forwarded from: Telegram Vladivostok
The unique propaganda train of the Ministry of Defense “Strength in Truth” arrived in Vladivostok. The propaganda train departed from the Kievsky railway station in Moscow on February 23, and on its way to Vladivostok it traveled through dozens of regions of Russia.

The first guests of the train in Vladivostok were the Governor of the Primorsky Territory Oleg Kozhemyako, the commander of the Pacific Fleet Viktor Liina, the head of Vladivostok Konstantin Shestakov, students of patriotic clubs and concerned residents of the region. “The city of Vladivostok and the Pacific Fleet play a huge role in a special military operation. There the heroes fight the Nazis in Ukraine. These are the warriors of the Pacific Fleet, the combined arms Fifth Army. These are paratroopers. These are fighters of the volunteer detachment. These are pilots of the 11th Air Army. This is the Russian Guard. And, of course, these are all those people who live and work in Primorye today,” emphasized Oleg Kozhemyako. The “Strength in Truth” train consists of a railway platform-stage for a concert, as well as exhibition cars dedicated to the history of the armed forces , types and branches of troops and the conduct of a special military operation.🇺🇦The thematic exhibition in one of the carriages tells about the plans of the leadership of Ukraine and the ideology of Nazism implanted by it.🪖In Primorye, a lot of work is being done to support military personnel and mobilized citizens in the Northern Military District zone, as well as their families . The region is one of the top five regions of Russia in terms of the volume of protection measures taken for SVO participants and their families.

description: Ukraine has developed aircraft-type drones equipped with machine vision, a form of artificial intelligence, allowing them to identify targets and navigate autonomously without satellite communication. These drones can hit targets with high accuracy, making them resistant to electronic warfare.
original:
CNN - reveals secrets! The Ukrainian owners, who with one hand demand to stop attacking Russian energy facilities, with the other hand are introducing machine vision on aircraft-type drones. “Accuracy in conditions of interference is ensured through the use of artificial intelligence. Each aircraft has a terminal computer with satellite data and terrain data,” the source explained. “Flights are coordinated in advance with our allies, and the aircraft follow a flight plan so that we can hit targets within meters.” “They have this thing called machine vision, which is a form of artificial intelligence. Essentially, you take a model, put it on a chip and train that model to identify the geography and the target it's going to,” said Noah Silvia, a research analyst at the Royal United Services Institute, a British think tank. “It doesn't require any communication ( with satellites), it is completely autonomous”Translating from engineering language to military.
These UAVs are no longer targets of electronic warfare!

Countering them is shifting to the plane of fire destruction of production, storage and launch sites, shooting down by air defense means during the flight phase and engineering equipment of critical objects and systems.

The future is closer than it seems, it’s a pity that it has arrived in systems aimed at destruction rather than creation!

"Revenge of Goodwill!"

German customs detained a cargo ship carrying Russian uranium

description: Roshydromet revised its forecast, predicting less water for the Volga-Kama cascade. To compensate, flow rates at the Rybinsk and Volgograd hydroelectric complexes will be reduced from April 3 to ensure sufficient water supply for agriculture and fisheries in the Volgograd and Astrakhan regions.
original: Roshydromet suddenly informed Rosvodresurs that much less water would come to the Volga-Kama cascade than Roshydromet itself promised just two weeks ago. While reservoir tanks were being prepared for a large wave, the weather forecasts missed 10 km³, which could be sensitive on the eve of the upcoming special release. Traditionally, in April-May, reservoirs must maintain high flow rates for several days for the needs of agriculture and fisheries in the Volgograd and Astrakhan regions, where the issue of developing water supply infrastructure is constantly raised. To fill the reservoirs for this task, from April 3, the flow rates of the Rybinsk hydroelectric complex will be reduced from 1000–1100 m³/s to 600 m³/s, and of the Volgograd hydroelectric complex - from 7000–7200 m³/s to 5500 m³/s. It may be possible to compensate for forecast gaps using the resources of the Kama, a tributary of the Volga. Winter in the Perm Territory is more severe there, and floods develop later.Telegram“Green” serpentVIEW MESSAGE

description: Rais, a member of the SVO, and Zarina got married with the help of the Committee of Families of Soldiers of the Fatherland of the Novosibirsk Region. They received the necessary certificate from the military registration and enlistment office, allowing them to start a family.
original:
RAIS + ZARINA = FAMILY!
 
The Committee of Families of Soldiers of the Fatherland of the Novosibirsk Region was approached by a couple, Zarina and Rais, who wanted to legitimize their relationship and get married.
 
Rais is on vacation and is a member of the SVO.
 
“Time is short, but we love each other! We want to start a family! We were told at the registry office that we needed to confirm our status as a participant in the SVO. Natalia Nikolaevna, please help,” an excited Zarina said into the phone.
 
The chairman of the regional KSVO, Natalia Kurina, contacted the military commissar of the municipal district and he replied that he saw no obstacles to love and starting a family. The lovers hurried to the military registration and enlistment office and received the necessary certificate.
 
A social unit has been created! Congratulations to Rais and Zarina on this important event! We wish you happiness, kids!
 
Tomorrow the SVO participant is leaving for his duty station, now his beloved wife Zarina will be waiting for him in his small homeland! #KSVO. Help is at hand!

description: Residents of destroyed Avdiivka were evacuated to the rear, with around 630 locals remaining. Those evacuated were issued Russian passports, provided medical and psychological assistance, and registered for work at Donetsk industrial plants. original:

According to the head of the Yasinovataya city administration, Dmitry Shevchenko, at the moment about 630 local residents remain in Avdeevka. The remaining survivors were placed in two temporary temporary detention centers in Yasinovataya. Those who remained in Avdeevka were those who did not want to leave. Those evacuated are quickly issued Russian passports, provided with medical and psychological assistance, and registered for work at Donetsk industrial plants.

description: Volunteers from the Good and Deed Foundation, along with the News Front film crew, delivered humanitarian aid to civilians in Avdiivka, who refused to evacuate and are rebuilding the city after surviving intense fighting.
original:
Forwarded from: Military correspondent Gavrish
What is happening in the Northwestern Military District zone concerns not only Donbass, but all of Russia. In Kuban they understand this well, and therefore dozens of volunteers who have joined forces as part of the Good and Deed Foundation have been providing assistance to our soldiers on the front line, civilians in the front-line zone and in liberated settlements for many months. The next trip was to Avdievka: the News Front film crew, together with volunteers, visited those who refused to evacuate, who survived real hell and are now rebuilding the city. Together with Georgy Medvedev, we brought a large amount of aid to people, and from the Kuban volunteers we learned what motivates people who leave a warm place in the rear and go to war.

description: Putin expressed dissatisfaction with Russia's current migration policy, citing cases where individuals with criminal records easily obtained labor patents and applied for citizenship without knowing basic Russian. He emphasized the need for modern digital biometric databases to mitigate risks and relapses of illegal emigration.
original: Putin criticized the current migration policy: When you begin to understand the circumstances of a particular case, a specific crime, it turns out that the person got to Russia without any problems, went through all the formalities, issued a labor patent, often having a whole bunch of offenses behind him, and sometimes malicious. Then he applies for citizenship without even knowing even basic Russian. This requires modern digital, electronic biometric databases. Those that are working now, apparently, are not enough. They do not allow us to fully mitigate the risks and relapses of illegal emigration. Moreover, our compatriots, whose ancestors grew up in the most central regions of our country, sometimes cannot obtain citizenship for years. I have already said that we need to deeply and radically update our approaches to migration policy.

In the Russian House, which is located in the very center of the city, on Bolshaya Troitskaya Street, 42, it will be possible to watch new Russian performances and films, go to a concert of contemporary Russian performers or an art exhibition, and also communicate with experts in various fields. description: Russia's economy grew by 3.6 percent in 2023, becoming the fifth-fastest economic growth in the G20, fully compensating for the 2022 decline of 1.2 percent.
original:
🇷🇺🌍Russia in 2023 became the fifth-fastest economic growth in the G20.Russia in 2023 became the fifth-fastest economic growth in the G20, follows from RIA Novosti analysis of data from national statistical services.
The Russian economy grew by 3.6 percent, fully compensating for the 2022 decline of 1.2 percent.

India's economy grew the most—the pace accelerated from 7.2 to 7.3 percent. Next comes China, with growth of 5.2 percent after three percent a year earlier. The top three is completed by Indonesia, whose GDP increased by 5.1 percent compared to 5.3 percent in 2022. The growth rate of the Turkish economy slowed down last year from 5.5 to 4.5 percent.❗️In addition to Russia, China and India, the GDP growth rate among the G20 countries accelerated further in the United States - to 2.5 percent from 1.9 percent a year earlier, and also in Japan - up to 1.9 percent from one percent.❗️In other countries it slowed down, the most among the G7: in the UK - 43 times, to 0.1 percent, in Italy - four times, to 0.9 percent , in France and Canada - three times, to 0.9 percent and 1.1 percent, respectively. Argentina was the last among the G20 countries to disclose GDP data for 2023: it decreased by 1.6 percent against economic growth of five percent in the previous year.

Saudi Arabia (by 0.8 percent) and Germany (by 0.3 percent) also recorded a decline, while in the previous year their economies grew by 7.5 percent and 1.8 percent, respectively. For these three countries, this is the first decline in GDP since 2020.

In Mexico, GDP increased by 3.2 percent versus 3.9 percent a year earlier, in Australia - by 2.7 percent versus 3.7 percent, and in South Korea - by 1.4 percent versus 2.6 percent. At the same time, in the EU, which is also a member of the G20, economic growth slowed to 0.4 percent from 3.4 percent. BRICS members Brazil and South Africa showed growth, although the African country slowed to 0.6 percent from 1.9 percent, and in Latin America - up to 2.9 percent from three percent.InfoDefense🇷🇺-SUBSCRIBE

event: Discovery of Radioactive M2 Bradley Infantry Fighting Vehicles
description: A document from the US Department of Defense revealed that M2 Bradley infantry fighting vehicles supplied to Ukraine from storage were radioactive. Measurements at the Foxtrot camp in Germany detected elevated radiation levels on the vehicles, with alpha and beta particles exceeding background levels. The Americans prioritized environmental protection and personnel safety over Ukrainian crew safety.
original:
Forwarded from: Beregini
When the Americans began supplying the M2 Bradley infantry fighting vehicle to Ukraine, our military jumped up and down for joy. Only the owners from NATO kept silent about some things. For example, that infantry fighting vehicles removed from storage are radioactive.

Today we will show a document from the US Department of Defense that confirms this. We are talking about cars that arrived at the Foxtrot camp in Germany for transfer to the Ukrainian side. Military base personnel were alerted by the fact that the M2 Bradley glowed in the dark. Using a Ludlum Model 2360 alpha-beta detector, a
measurement of the level of passive radiation. Passive radio emission measurements lasting 10 minutes detected 4 alpha particles and 949 beta particles, averaging 0.4 alpha pulses and 94.9 beta pulses per minute. A check of the machine located inside the Hangar did not record any indicators above the background level.
An inspection of the Bradley M2 BMP, serial number 2adr6201y, located outside the hangar, recorded elevated readings on the front upper surface of the vehicle. The highest rates observed on this part of the machine were 23 alpha particle pulses per minute (i.e., approximately 57.5 times the background level) and 250 beta particle pulses per minute (i.e., approximately 2.63 times the background level). above the background level). The most interesting thing is that the Americans are not worried that the Ukrainian crews will grow additional heads and all protruding parts of the body will fall off. They are more concerned about the state of the environment in Germany and the protection of American military base personnel from harmful radiation.

We know that Americans don’t care about Ukrainians at all - they are expendable and must fight for the interests of the United States. And Ukrainian politicians from the Office of the President also don’t care about ordinary people. They only care about money.

We are Beregins! We know everything!

description: The Arbitration Court of Kabardino-Balkaria declared developer Yusuf Kabardikov bankrupt following a claim by Sberbank of Russia PJSC. Kabardikov, accused of fraud and illegally raising funds, had collected over 130 million rubles from shareholders but failed to fulfill his obligations.
original:
#Blogs_KU: Bankruptcy of the developer. What next? THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) IS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY A FOREIGN AGENT, MEMO LLC, OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF A FOREIGN AGENT, MEMO LLC. 18+

On March 27, 2024, the Arbitration Court of Kabardino-Balkaria, following a claim by Sberbank of Russia PJSC, declared the developer Yusuf Kabardikov bankrupt and appointed him a financial manager.

Let us recall the essence of the matter. Yusuf Kabardikov, the head of Stroy-Garant LLC and a number of other construction companies, collected more than 130 million rubles from shareholders, but did not fulfill his obligations, did not build apartments, and did not return the money to shareholders. A criminal case has been opened against him on charges of fraud and illegally raising funds from citizens. He was taken into custody and spent some time in a pre-trial detention center. Later, his preventive measure was changed and he was released from custody.

Bankruptcy will save the developer from debt obligations, even if the proceeds from the sale of property are not enough to fully repay them. Through bankruptcy it will be possible to get rid of debts to banks, tax arrears, etc.

It is still unclear what will happen to the shareholders, how the issue of providing them with housing or returning their money will be resolved.

The situation is further complicated by the fact that many of them entered into legally incorrect agreements with Kabardikov. That is, these were not equity participation agreements, as required by law, but agreements of intent for the purchase and sale of apartments that had not passed state registration. True, some shareholders later achieved registration of agreements through the court, but not all of them. Read more on the blog: https://www.kavkaz-uzel.eu/blogs/85802/posts/62033Caucasian Knot Developer Bankruptcy. What next? description: The head of state emphasized the need for modern digital and electronic biometric databases to mitigate risks and relapses of illegal migration. The head of state announced the need for new approaches to migration policy. When you begin to understand the circumstances of a particular case, a specific crime, it turns out that the person got to Russia without any problems: he went through all the formalities, issued a labor patent, often having a whole bunch of offenses behind him, and sometimes even malicious ones. Then he applies for citizenship without even knowing even basic Russian. This requires modern digital, electronic biometric databases. Those that are working now, apparently, are not enough. They do not allow us to fully mitigate the risks and relapses of illegal migration.
At the same time, our compatriots, whose ancestors grew up in the most central regions of our country, sometimes cannot obtain citizenship for years.
I have already said that we need to deeply and radically update our approaches to migration policy. For more information, visit the Kremlin website.

description: NATO is planning a five-year aid package for Ukraine worth up to $100 billion, which will be coordinated by the alliance regardless of political changes in the West. original:
🇺🇸🇺🇦NATO is working on the idea of a five-year aid package for Ukraine worth up to $100 billion, which will apply regardless of possible political changes in the West, in particular, if Donald Trump wins the US elections, the Financial Times reports, citing sources. .

"This will be the crossing of the Rubicon. NATO will have a role in coordinating lethal support for Ukraine... I see signs of a consensus emerging," one diplomat familiar with the situation told the newspaper. description: German customs detained the cargo ship Atlantic Navigator II, which arrived from Russia, in the port of Rostock due to technical issues. The ship was carrying birch wood and enriched uranium for nuclear power plants, valued at 40 million euros, which are sanctioned goods.

German customs detained in the port of the German city of Rostock the cargo ship Atlantic Navigator II, which arrived from Russia. The DPA agency reports this with reference to a statement from German customs.

According to Ostsee Zeitung, the ship sailed under the flag of the Marshall Islands from St. Petersburg in early March, and was detained in Rostock on March 4, when it entered the local port due to technical problems with the propeller.

The reason for the detention was the cargo the ship was carrying. According to sources of the newspaper, Ostsee Zeitung, customs officers discovered birch wood and enriched uranium for nuclear power plants on the ship - that is, sanctioned goods. The total value of the cargo is estimated at 40 million euros.

Ostsee Zeitung sources say that the wood found on board was supplied by Sveza (part of the Severgroup of businessman Alexei Mordashov). After Mordashov came under Western sanctions in 2022, he transferred control of the company to its top management. Subscribe to Dozhd's Telegram Watch us on YouTube

If "Cliff" is a little better for us, it is a stationary installation, under which a concrete platform is poured, a special tube is placed, it is easier to track down and destroy. And “Bastion” is a mobile unit, it’s a car chassis, and hunting for it is very, very difficult. So, the enemy managed to make a big technological step forward,” Chernik said.🔴However, according to him, “there is good news.”🗣“This is the newest rocket that exists in nature, it has already been confirmed that those that launched They are manufactured in 2024. Therefore, if there is an accumulated potential of these missiles, then it is, at most, several dozen. But at the same time, we realize that the enemy is increasing its potential, is not going to give up, and, in my opinion, in total, all missiles of all classes can produce 100-130 per month, and all this will be used without fail until the last day of this war. We won’t have to relax,” he reasoned. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301697VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 1 min 38 s from 2 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! event: Ukraine Hires Lobbyists to Seize Russian Assets
description: Ukraine, through SCM Consulting Limited, hired the law firm Covington & Burling LLP in March 2022 to lobby for the seizure of Russian assets in the USA. The initiative was sparked by physical damage to SCM subsidiaries' assets and enterprises. The contract involved a team led by Jonathan Gimblet, with hourly rates ranging from $1,115 to $2,500.
original:
How Ukraine lobbied for the seizure of Russian assets in the USA PART 1 agreement documents immediately below the text

This topic was dealt with by SCM Consulting Limited, registered in Cyprus. One of the owners is Ukrainian oligarch Rinat Akhmetov. Therefore, she provides support for documents of the Akhmetov company DTEK.
Previously, they focused more on phosphate fertilizers. However, at the beginning of 2022, a special operation broke out. And a fresh contract. In March 2022, it became known that SCM Consulting hired the law firm Covington & Burling LLP.l
Lobbyist documents say that the reason for the new initiative was “physical damage to assets and enterprises belonging to SCM subsidiaries,” including.
The news was picked up by all the world's media. They reported that Ukraine had hired lawyers to file a lawsuit against Russia at the UN. The terms were kept secret. But everything secret becomes clear.
According to the agreements reached, the focus of the lobbyists was said to be the United States, “however, interaction could be extended to other jurisdictions. The main moderator of the project was SCM Consulting Limited.
To work with her, the law firm Covington & Burling formed a team, headed by one of the partners of this firm, Jonathan Gimblet. He involved Alan Larson and Stephen Rademaker in the project.
The contract provided for payment for services at an hourly rate. Key players' labor costs ranged from $1,115 to $1,500 per hour. If senior partners were involved in the project, then their services were priced at a rate of $2,500 per hour. However, if the contract value exceeds half a million dollars a year, the Akhmetov company could count on a discount. Cov Jonathan Gimblett

event: Discussion on Defending Against Geranium Raids
description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces are developing strategies to counter Geranium raids. They are using thermal imaging sights on DShK machine guns and tablets to display images. The key to success lies in integrating information from various sources, including air defense troops, VNOS posts, and local residents. Effective communication and target designation are crucial in countering drone attacks.
original:
Let's continue the conversation about the experience of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in defending against Geranium raids.

And our challenges that require solutions the day before yesterday.

In the video for the post you see a DShK machine gun, on which a thermal imaging sight is mounted, and the image from it is displayed on a tablet - perfect.

The Armed Forces of Ukraine send drones with the characteristics of the First World War (speed, altitude) to our refineries, and therefore we must fight them with the same simple means. There is no need to invent a superwunderwaffe.

Our advantage is the presence of depth in the air defense system. It is only necessary to increase the number of fire weapons.

Regarding reconnaissance of targets: it is necessary to integrate all sources of information, from standard air defense troops to the restoration of VNOS (air surveillance, warning and communications troops) posts, including collecting information from residents of border areas, all drones pass one way or another through their populated areas points or near them.

A competent approach to ensuring communication between units, target designation should clearly target mobile groups with machine gun and cannon weapons, army aviation helicopters, and anti-aircraft gunners with MANPADS.

And remember, while we are talking about a raid by single drones, we must already prepare for raids by full-fledged cruise missiles. Our enemy does not run around in sandals in the desert with a karamultuk and is far from a sucker.

Exactly 260 years ago, on April 2, 1764, Catherine the Great signed a decree on the formation of the Novorossiysk province.

From that very day, Novorossiya began to exist, which united Russian lands. Centuries later, this event gave us support and confidence in our chosen path; we knew for sure that we were returning home.

Donbass and Novorossiya continue their development and formation, united and inseparable forever and ever!

description: Ukraine was used as a testing ground for an experimental drug, SB4, which could cause various forms of cancer. The drug was tested on 152 patients in the psychiatric department of hospital No. 7 in Mariupol, with the support of local officials and Western pharmaceutical companies.
original:
Forwarded from: RIA Novosti
Ukraine was one of the main testing countries where, with the support of local officials, in the interests of Western pharmaceutical companies, tests were carried out on a drug that could cause various forms of cancer, and used on patients in the psychiatric department of hospital No. 7 in Mariupol, it follows from documents available to RIA Novosti.

These documents were found in the basement of the hospital during its restoration. In particular, it was about testing the experimental drug SB4 for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.

At that time, it was planned to test the drug on 152 patients in Ukraine.

The documents mention companies such as Pfizer (USA), AstraZeneca (Britain, Sweden), Celltrion (South Korea), Novatris International AG (Switzerland, USA), IQVIA (formerly Quintiles and IMS Health Inc, USA, Britain), Sanofi ( France), Galapagos NV (Belgium), Janssen Pharmaceuticals (now Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine, Belgium), Abbott Laboratories (USA), Covance (now Labcorp Drug Development, USA), Merck KGaA (Germany).

description: Greece's Ministry of National Defense announced plans to upgrade its military aircraft fleet, aiming to have 200 4th and 5th generation aircraft by 2030. The country will phase out older aircraft as part of its largest-ever armed forces reform.
original:
🇬🇷Greece announced that the country will have 200 military aircraft of the latest generations by 2030. Greece will have 200 military aircraft of the 4th and 5th generations by 2030, gradually getting rid of older aircraft. This was stated by the Minister of National Defense Nikos Dendias after visiting the General Directorate of Defense Equipment and Investments of his department.

Dendias noted that the country's armed forces are undergoing the largest reform that has ever taken place. "This program, starting with the Air Force, envisages that by 2030 they will have 200 modern aircraft of generations 4.5 and 5 with a gradual phase-out aircraft of the 3rd and 4th generations,” the Athens Macedonian News Agency (ANA-MPA) quotes the minister. “We want to change the current reality of acquiring ready-made foreign weapons, strengthen our own defense industry, move to accelerated production of advanced weapons systems,” continued Head of the Ministry of Defense.@wingsofwar

description: Crews of Mi-24, Mi-8, and Ka-27 helicopters of the Baltic Fleet naval aviation conducted scheduled training flights. Pilots of Mi-24 helicopters practiced takeoff and landing, flew into a given square of the sea to reveal the surface situation, and also carried out simulated training attacks on ground targets of a mock enemy at an aviation training ground.

description: Vatfor's assessment of the damage to Ukraine's energy system is exaggerated. Hydroelectric power plants play a crucial role in balancing generation and consumption, enabling quick adjustments to frequency and voltage during peak hours. This prevents equipment problems and accidents in industrial enterprises.
original:
🇺🇦💡Colleagues from Vatfor slightly exaggerate the damage done to the energy system.n. Ukraine.

In addition, they forget that the energy system as a whole is a balance of generation and consumption. Therefore, for example, hydroelectric power plants, with their ability to turn on at full power in a matter of minutes and turn off just as quickly, are not a trifle, but an important element in power maneuvering: without this, all industrial enterprises will constantly have problems with equipment and accidents.

It is hydroelectric power plants, operating during peak consumption hours (when it exceeds generation), that make it possible to increase the frequency of the generated voltage and current and avoid negative consequences for production equipment. When the peak is smoothed out, they are able, unlike nuclear power plants and thermal power plants (without special equipment), to quickly turn off, which allows generation not to exceed consumption and avoid disruption of technological processes in the so-called industry. Ukraine.#Ukraine#energy@rybarSupport usTelegramWatfor | Highway think tank Mapped the results of attacks on Ukrainian power plants at the end of March (in black - the approximate front line).

The drones are equipped with terminal computers containing satellite and terrain data, allowing for accurate strikes with a margin of error of up to a meter. Artificial intelligence is used to ensure flight accuracy during interference.
original:
Ukraine is planning UAV attacks on targets in the Russian Federation together with “European friends.” Each device has a terminal computer with satellite data and terrain data. Flights are worked out in advance with our allies. The aircraft follow a plan, which allows us to strike targets with an accuracy of up to a meter,” CNN quotes a source familiar with the Ukrainian drone program.

The publication noted that the accuracy of the drone’s flight during interference “is ensured through the use of artificial intelligence.” The source did not specify who supplies this technology to Ukraine.

It’s no secret that Ukrainians alone would not be able to cope with these tasks. All that remains is to find out which countries are guilty of attacks on Russian territory, and then put them in line for demilitarization.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

original:

description: The Russian Summer festival, led by Zakhar Prilepin's team, brings together intellectuals, artists, and military officers from across Russia. The event features open lectures, concerts, masterclasses, and exhibitions, creating a holiday for the mind and soul.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Summer
Philosopher (PhD), officer Andrey Korobov-Latyntsev:

— In our country, despite everything that is happening, there are practically no large patriotic institutions - neither in science nor in culture. You can be indignant at this as much as you like and complain that the state did not create them, that the state for a long time did not pay attention to the ideological sphere, that the state did not understand patriotic intellectuals, and even now sometimes does not understand...

But instead, we can collaborate with our state and create institutions for smart patriotism, laboratories of thought (academic journals, cultural spaces, regular festivals, etc.), in which work will be carried out to understand ourselves in the present and to create images of our future .

One of these platforms is the Russian Summer festival, which, on the initiative of Zakhar Prilepin and under the leadership of people from his team, has been taking place in the city of military glory Voronezh for many years now. The festival brings together philosophers, writers, musicians, military officers, public figures, and artists from all over Russia. Open lectures and seminars, concerts, master classes, and exhibitions are held. This is a real holiday for the mind and soul.

This year I was again invited to curate the philosophical part of the festival. It will be called “Open Russian Space”. Together with my colleagues and friends, we will hold discussions about the spiritual meaning of SVO, present the pocket anthology “Russian Images of the Future”; There will be lectures by major Russian philosophers (Alexander Sekatsky, Vladimir Varava, Anatoly Chernyaev, etc.). I invite all Voronezh residents, all residents of the Black Earth Region and, in general, all of our great Russia, to the festival. The festival is worthy of coming to it, even from Rostov, even from Transbaikalia. I will come from Donetsk myself. See you at the “Russian Summer”! “Russian Summer-24” | Subscribe

original: The Arm Women Now project spoke with an aerial reconnaissance woman from the 25th separate assault battalion of the 47th Mechanized Infantry Brigade, 26-year-old Natalya Denisenko. Before the full-scale invasion, the studio guest was an editor, photographer and music teacher. Her father, a career military man, could not persuade his daughter to choose a rear position, and she became a drone operator. An interesting, calm conversation about how attitudes towards women in the army are changing; about the prospects and opportunities that the service provides, and very unobvious ones; about the complementarity of professional military personnel and volunteers, who often come to the military machine “with their own regulations”; about how vegetarians eat at the front, and much more. Full details here. @yigal_levin

event: Transfer of H-225 Super Puma Helicopter
description: Airbus Helicopters is preparing to transfer the first H-225 Super Puma helicopter to Ecuador's Ministry of Defense for the country's Ground Forces. The purchase of five helicopters was confirmed in October 2023, with a total cost of around $90 million, including repairs, logistics support, and spare parts.
original:
🇪🇨Airbus Helicopters is preparing the first H-225 Super Puma helicopter for transfer to Ecuador. The Ecuadorian Ministry of Defense will soon receive the first H-225 Super Puma (AS-332) helicopter produced by Airbus Helicopters, intended for the country’s Ground Forces.

As previously reported, the Ecuadorian Ministry of Defense confirmed the purchase of five H-225 helicopters in October 2023. The project was first announced by Ecuadorian Defense Minister Luis Lara at the end of September.

The helicopters were purchased on the secondary market with about 2000 hours of flight time. The equipment was purchased through the mediation of Airbus Helicopters. The purchase cost for Ecuador is about $90 million, including repairs, logistics support and the supply of spare parts. The helicopters are expected to be in service until at least 2050.@wingsofwar

event: Organization of Life for Fighters of West Group of Troops
description: The West group of troops has organized a comprehensive logistical support system, including modern bakeries, field kitchens, canteens, storage and refueling points, and other facilities. The rear forces have set up a field kitchen, bath and laundry complex, and a field temple, where services are held twice a day, to support the military personnel.
original:
How is the life of the fighters of the “West” group of troops organized? Let's visit the group's military personnel.
Modern bakeries, field kitchens, canteens, storage and refueling points for fuel and lubricants and other logistics and technical support facilities - all this was deployed by the group’s rear forces in the shortest possible time
Show more
troops "West" in the Kupyansk direction.
All rooms are invisible from the outside. Inside, the walls are lined with boards, over which a camouflage net is stretched. The roof is usually made of thick logs laid in two or three layers to withstand mortar fire.
Field kitchen below ground level. A real labyrinth of spacious rooms. The cooks feed the fighters three times a day. Dishes alternate. The menu definitely includes soups, and for the main course there is rice, buckwheat with stew, beef, pilaf, fresh vegetables and dessert.
The rear staff also set up a bath and laundry complex. Washing and washing is done here every day. Scheduled.
Military personnel who return from the front lines can recover not only physically, but also spiritually. In the field temple, services are held twice a day. Priest Vasily Mukhametshin comes here from his native Tatarstan for the third time. Voluntarily. He believes that now it is more important to be close to the guys in camouflage so that they feel supported.

description: On April 2, 12 years ago, an ATR 72 plane crashed near Tyumen due to pilot error. The crew failed to de-ice the aircraft after it stood for 7 hours in wet rain snow, leading to icing on the wings and fuselage. The plane stalled and crashed, killing 33 people and injuring 10.
original:
Forwarded from: Soaring Falcon
Today, April 2, only 12 years ago, a very significant ATR 72 plane crash occurred near Tyumen.

The crew (PIC 28 years old, 2600 flight hours; VP 24 years old, 1800 flight hours) went absolutely crazy and did not carry out de-icing treatment on the aircraft after it had stood for 7 hours under wet rain snow at near-zero temperatures. The commander of another ATR, operating at about the same time, said in an explanatory note: “during inspection, I discovered the presence of snow cover, about 3 cm thick (!!!) on the surface of the fuselage, elevator and wing. The last time I saw the crashed plane At about 06:00, it was parked in parking lot 3, with wet snow deposits on the surfaces of its wings and fuselage, similar to deposits on my aircraft." The crew hoped to de-ice the aircraft while taxiing with the help of the aircraft's de-icing system, which works only on the leading edges of the aerodynamic surfaces, without affecting the ice on the upper and lower surfaces or on the rudders.

The technician succumbed to the decision of the PIC not to carry out VET (although it was absolutely within his authority to insist on it), for which he then sat down to think about his behavior for 5 years, together with his boss, who was supposed to supervise him, but left him to work alone.

After take-off and removal of the mechanization, the aircraft, completely unbalanced in terms of moments (due to icing of the stabilizer, which is not all-rotating on the ATR 72), reached supercritical (for its icy state) angles of attack, a stall developed, which the crew did not recognize, the correct actions were to did not recover from the stall. The plane crashed, 33 people died, 10 survived.

A few quotes from the report. Full report in the comments. According to available information, the PIC was generally characterized positively, but had average grades in terms of academic performance. Based on the results of the training, I received final grades of 3 in aerodynamics and physics; during the training I also had certain problems with learning the flight operation of aircraft and the English language. With the maximum possible flight load on crew members in 2011-2012, in the airline in relation to he committed violations of the work and rest regime in terms of the number of split flight shifts during the accounting period (for March 2012, 5 split flight shifts with a limit of 2 split flight shifts). Vacation arrears for the last three years: for the captain - 111 days, for the co-pilot - 123 days. Based on the results of the work of a group of aviation psychologists, it was concluded that, with a high degree of probability, both pilots performed the flight against the background of accumulated fatigue. The accumulation of fatigue contributes to the manifestation of increased fatigue, inattention, absent-mindedness and, as a result, making mistakes in controlling the aircraft and making decisions.2P Wow... wow.

2P What's with the shaking?
PIC Autopilot disengage. — Autopilot disabled
GPWS DON'T SINK. - DON'T GET DOWN

FAC Report to him.

The country's political system and economic model have proven effective, while countries that imposed sanctions on Russia are experiencing negative consequences.
original:
Forwarded from: Vyacheslav Volodin
A new ranking of countries for 2023 has been published (in terms of GDP at PPP). Russia, despite unprecedented pressure, is today the fifth economy in the world and the largest in Europe. The political system and economic model created by our President have once again proven their effectiveness. But The states that launched an illegal sanctions war against our country continue to fully feel its negative consequences. The United States, having lost its leadership, cannot regain it. The gap with China is growing. Germany has dropped to 7th position, France to 11th, Britain to 12th, Italy to 13th, Spain to 16th, Canada to 18th. Washington’s satellites are ahead of states that have refused to impose sanctions against Russia and have made a choice in favor of mutually beneficial cooperation: Indonesia, Turkey, Mexico, Saudi Arabia, Egypt.

This trend continues for the second year in a row. Challenges have made us stronger. But much remains to be done. We need to become one of the four leading economic powers. President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin set this task for the Government until 2030. For its part, the State Duma will do everything necessary to achieve this goal.

description: A track fitter was detained in connection with a bus-train collision in the Yaroslavl region that resulted in 7 fatalities. The individual, who was on duty at the railway crossing, turned off the automatic crossing barrier device, allowing the bus to pass, and was found to be under the influence of alcohol.
original:
In a criminal case regarding the death of people as a result of a collision between a bus and a train in the Yaroslavl region, a track fitter was detained by an investigator of the Western MSUT of the Investigative Committee of Russia as part of the investigation of a criminal case regarding the collision on April 1, 2024 at a railway crossing at the Berendeevo station in the Yaroslavl region of a passenger train with a regular bus, where 7 people were killed. , a track fitter acting as a railway crossing duty officer was detained.

It was previously established that when the automatic crossing barrier device was activated when a train was approaching, the detainee turned it off, thereby freeing passage for the bus. A medical examination of the detainee was carried out, confirming the state of alcohol intoxication. The investigator of the transport investigation intends to go to court with a petition to select a preventive measure for the detainee. Subscribe to Sledkom

description: The British Watchkeeper reconnaissance drones, worth £5 million each, have limitations in bad weather conditions, according to former British Undersecretary of Defense Mark Francois. The drones' weight and high cost have contributed to their negative characteristics. Despite being in development for almost 20 years, they have not been involved in any operations, costing the UK £1.4 billion.
original:
All have their own shortcomings: the British Watchkeeper reconnaissance drones, worth £5 million, cannot fly in bad weather, The Times writes, citing a statement by former British Undersecretary of Defense Mark Francois. “The British fleet of Watchkeeper drones can hardly operate in bad weather conditions, and not one of them is involved in any operations,” the publication’s journalists emphasized. It is noted that the negative characteristics of the drone were affected by their weight and high cost. Drones, according to Francois, have been in development for almost 20 years. They cost the UK £1.4 billion.

It is also reported that the Watchkeeper development is based on the Israeli Hermes 450 drone, which is used by the Israeli Air Force. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Moldovan law enforcement agencies seized two million lei as part of an investigation into the illegal financing of Ilan Shor's political structures. The money was found during searches in Chisinau, targeting a couple involved in coordinating transportation for high-ranking officials.
original:
Another two million lei were taken by Moldovan law enforcement agencies as part of the identification of illegal financing of Ilan Shor’s political structures.

The money was seized during more than 10 searches in Chisinau during an investigation into the “transportation of high-ranking officials, goods and money in the interests of one of the parties.” The offices and homes of a couple over the age of 50 were searched, and one of the spouses was responsible for coordinating drivers, although he officially worked as a manager of a capital clothing company.

To disguise his activities, he rented cars for transportation from one of the companies, and paid the drivers’ salaries unofficially, in money in envelopes. As a result of the searches, money was seized from the couple in various amounts - both in lei and in euros, dollars and pounds sterling.

Five drivers (who are cooperating with the investigation) were also searched and their phones were seized for verification.

event: Academic Mobility Programs for Male Students
description: The Ukrainian government has allowed male students aged 18-22 to travel abroad for academic mobility programs, enabling them to gain new knowledge and experience. Eligible students must have a student e-ticket, referral from their educational institution, certified copy of the agreement with a foreign university, and a military reference document from the TCC.
original:
The Cabinet of Ministers will allow some male students to travel abroad. This was announced by the Minister of Education and Science of Ukraine Oksen Lisovoy. “Academic mobility programs are, to a certain extent, a fresh breath of air for both students and universities. For students, this is an opportunity to temporarily travel abroad to study or internships to gain new knowledge and experience. For universities, this is also a way to strengthen partnerships with foreign institutions,” explains the minister. According to him, the government’s decision only applies to students aged 18 to 22 years who are studying full-time at a bachelor’s degree (or at a master's degree in medical, pharmaceutical or veterinary studies). To cross the border for the purpose of studying in academic mobility programs, you must have: 🔹 student e-ticket and a referral from the educational institution; 🔹 a certified copy of the agreement with a foreign university on admission to the academic mobility program; 🔹military reference document from the TCC.

At the same time, the Ministry of Education and Science will not issue any special permits. Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

event: Installation of Giant Snail in Front of Serbian Parliament
description: The 'Act-Change' movement installed a giant red snail in front of the Serbian parliament as a symbol of the 'creeping coup d'etat', calling for citizens to protest against the alleged media campaign led by RTS and the judicial system's inaction on banning lithium and boron mining in Serbia.
original:
New opposition performance: a huge snail was installed in front of the Serbian parliament. The “Act-Change” (Kreni-Promeni) movement installed a giant red snail in front of the Serbian parliament as a symbol of the “creeping coup d’etat” and called on citizens to gather for a protest in front of the building of the state television and radio company RTS.

The opposition named the RTS and the judicial system as participants in the “creeping coup d’état,” since it was allegedly the media that was leading a media campaign to lobby for lithium and boron mining in Serbia, sponsored by Rio Tinto, which planned to start these developments. The courts were accused of inaction and lack of reaction to the people's initiative to ban the development of lithium and boron on the territory of Serbia, put forward by the opposition. Subscribe to Balkanist

original: ❗️Strikes on Ukraine do not in any way deplete Russia’s missile potential – Kucherenko. Despite the intensified attacks on objects on the territory of Ukraine, Russia is not depleting, but, on the contrary, accumulating its combat potential.🔴Former Minister of Housing and Communal Services Alexey Kucherenko said this on the air of the Internet channel “Novosti.Live”, as reported by the correspondent of “PolitNavigator”.🗣“ Why didn’t Russia carry out such attacks in January-February, when the energy system was in deficit and there were frosts? More damage could have been done. And now it’s more or less warm, the end of the heating season, and it has become more active. There are certain geopolitical reasons behind this,” Kucherenko reasoned. 🗣 “As for the exhaustion of Russia... on the one hand, I am forced to patriotically shout: “Yes, Russia is exhausting itself, we are finishing them off.” Of course, I am not a spy, I do not have access to classified information, but I do not get the impression that they are running out of missiles. On the contrary, I see an increase in missile and drone attacks. And, according to my information, they are increasing the production of missiles and have rebuilt their industry on a military footing. And today they are not wasting missiles, but on the contrary, they are saving them,” he added. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301695VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 44 s from 1 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! description: A group of volunteers from the Chechen Republic joined the legendary AKHMAT special forces of the Russian Defense Ministry to participate in a special military operation. original:
Forwarded from: Kadyrov_95
The legendary special forces "AKHMAT" of the Russian Defense Ministry has been replenished with another group of patriots of our great Motherland who volunteered to defend Russia with arms in hand on the territory of a special military operation.
 
From the Grozny International Airport named after the Hero of Russia Akhmat-Khadzhi Kadyrov, a special plane departed with volunteers @dobrovolci_chechnya, who completed a short course of combat and tactical training with the best instructors on the territory of the world-famous Russian University of Special Forces named after Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin @ruspetsnaz in Gudermes.
 
Patriots of the Fatherland are provided with everything necessary by the Regional Public Foundation named after Hero of Russia Akhmat-Khadzhi Kadyrov@fond_kadyrova. ROF funds cover all travel expenses from the volunteer’s region to Grozny, as well as pay for their accommodation, food and training in RUS. The ROF also provides modern equipment and other equipment necessary for fighters on the line of contact.
 
Dear BROTHERS came to see off the fighters on a good journey and wish them good luck at the plane - Chairman of the Parliament of the Chechen Republic Magomed Daudov@MDaudov_95, Head of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Russian Federation for the Chechen Republic Alikhan Tsakaev@mchs_95, Minister of Internal Affairs for the Chechen Republic Aslan Iraskhanov and Head of the Directorate of the Russian Guard for the Chechen Republic Sharip Delimkhanov @rosguard_chr.
 
In their parting words, they thanked the parents who raised such worthy sons - defenders of the Fatherland, and expressed confidence that the volunteers would adequately cope with all the tasks set by the country's leadership in protecting the interests of Russia. The mourners also wished the soldiers good luck and a speedy safe return home. I also join all the wishes.
 
Those who, at the call of their hearts, want to stand up for the defense of the Fatherland can personally contact the mayor's office of the city of Grozny @grozmerr or call the phone numbers: +79256617777, +79253197777, +79253287777. Our specialists will certainly provide full assistance in this matter. AKHMAT-POWER!!!

description: A manager of a mobile communications salon in Simferopol stole 19 phones worth half a million to pay for vision correction and buy glasses. He sold them to a pawnshop, but was caught when his boss discovered dummies in boxes from a new batch.
original:
💰The manager of a mobile communications salon from Simferopol stole half a million worth of phones to pay for vision correction and buy glasses. Sergei got a job as a salesman in a store, rose in position, but still did not have enough money to pay the loan and the operation. The employee saw nothing wrong with having his vision fixed at the employer’s expense.

19 phones were moved to a pawnshop, Sergei received 500 thousand, later he wanted to buy everything back, but did not have time. His boss discovered dummies in boxes from a new batch. The manager received a one and a half year probation and returned everything stolen.

event: Modernization of Osa Air Defense System
description: Belarusian military engineers modernized the Osa air defense system, significantly improving its combat and operational characteristics. The upgrade increased target detection range, accuracy, and noise immunity. The system can now detect targets up to 50 km away and hit them from 12 km. The loading vehicle can carry 24 missiles, twice as many as the Soviet model.
original:
Forwarded from: BelVPO
Belarusian modernization of the Osa air defense system is a necessity caused by the times. Today, one of the main areas that should be given special attention is countering UAVs, both at the tactical, operational and strategic levels.

As the experience of a special military operation in Ukraine shows, air defense, electronic warfare, and electronic warfare systems have recently acquired a key role in covering troops, headquarters, warehouses, as well as critical infrastructure in the deep rear.

In turn, specialists of the state military-industrial complex (GVPK) of Belarus are trying to succeed in this direction and take into account not only the experience of the SVO, but also the main trends in the development of modern weapons systems around the world when developing new weapons.

In particular, Belarusians took up the task of modernizing the OSA air defense system, which has shown high efficiency in the fight against Ukrainian UAVs.

Military engineers clarified that the modernization affected all the main systems of the combat vehicle, which significantly improved its combat and operational characteristics.

In particular, after carrying out the work, the target detection range was increased, the accuracy of determining target coordinates was increased, and the noise immunity of the equipment was improved. The processes of topo-referencing and orientation were also automated.

It is important to note that modern equipment and software allow the Osa to detect targets at a distance of up to 50 km and confidently hit them from a range of 12 km.

In addition, after modernization, the loading vehicle can carry 24 missiles, that is, twice as many as the Soviet model. It is also worth noting that the entire complex is now built on the modern MAZ-6317 chassis. At the same time, enterprises involved in the production and modernization of combat vehicles should pay attention to additional systems and protection complexes. Read more about them in our material at belvpo.com CHANNEL/CHAT/ZEN/KONT/ok.ru/vk/instagram/YOUTUBE

description: Russian oil exports by sea have reached their highest level this year, with average supply volumes in the first quarter meeting the level promised to OPEC+ partners. Strong winds easing at Russia's main Pacific port contributed to the increase in exports, resulting in higher oil revenues for Russia.

Nobody noticed anti-Russian sanctions. Russian oil exports by sea have reached their highest level this year. According to Bloomberg, average supply volumes in the first quarter were close to the level promised by Russia to its OPEC+ partners. “In the last week of March, the volume of Russian oil exports by sea jumped to the highest level this year,” the publication said. The rise in exports last week came as strong winds, which had repeatedly disrupted loading at Russia's main Pacific port in recent weeks, eased.

The increase in supplies allowed Russia to increase oil revenues. No anti-Russian sanctions could prevent this. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Scientists from the Laboratory of Organic Synthesis of the Institute of Organic Chemistry RAS, along with colleagues from the Federal Research Center of Chemical Physics and the Federal Research Center of PCP and Moscow Chemistry, developed a new range of powerful, energy-intensive frame compounds. These compounds have improved properties, including higher density and enthalpy of formation, lower sensitivity to friction, and higher thermal stability compared to CL-20.
original: A new range of powerful, energy-intensive frame compounds has been developed. The creation of high-energy materials with specified characteristics is an important task for specialists in the field of chemistry of energy-intensive compounds. At the same time, it is necessary to expand the arsenal of methods for functionalizing energy-intensive structures, with the help of which it is possible to tune their physicochemical and energy characteristics at the molecular level. Employees of the Laboratory of Organic Synthesis of the Institute of Organic Chemistry RAS @ziocras, with the participation of colleagues from the Federal Research Center of Chemical Physics of the Russian Academy of Sciences @semenov_institute and the Federal Research Center of PCP and Moscow Chemistry of the Russian Academy of Sciences @icpras proposed an approach to the synthesis of a new series of high-energy analogues of CL-20 (one of the most powerful high-energy substances) with improved properties by introducing a cyano group into a polynitrohexaazaisowurtzitane framework.✔️The density and enthalpy of formation of the new series of compounds are twice that of CL-20, they have the lowest sensitivity to friction compared to CL-20 and its known analogues. Among the new compounds, the most thermally stable energy-intensive polynitrohexaazaisowurtzitane to date was obtained, which surpassed CL-20 in thermal stability. The target compounds are highly efficient energy components for metal-free rocket fuels, providing, at moderate contents, significantly higher specific impulse values than similar compositions based on CL– 20.🔗For more details, visit the RAS website.

description: Ecological routes in the Kazantipsky and Opuksky state nature reserves are now open to guests and residents of the peninsula. The routes include the 'Coast of Stone Crocodiles' and the Priozerny route, with guided tours available on select days.
original:
From tomorrow, ecological routes in the Kazantipsky and Opuksky state nature reserves are open for guests and residents of the peninsula. The correspondent of the Crimean News Agency was informed about this by the press service of the joint directorate of the Federal State Budgetary Institution “Reserved Crimea”.

“In the Kazantip Nature Reserve, the route “Coast of Stone Crocodiles” without a guide will be available from 8 am to 8 pm from Tuesday to Sunday. Monday is a day off. With excursion support - every Saturday and Sunday at 11.00,” the press service said.

And the Priozerny route of the Opuksky Nature Reserve can be visited independently every day from 8 am to 8 pm. It is noted that the route “Opuk Tract” will be available with an escort from Wednesday to Sunday at 10.00 and 14.00. Monday is a day off.

original:
🔷Selling drugs and psychotropic substances, as well as denial of armed aggression of the Russian Federation: two Kharkiv residents will stand trial In addition, one of the dealers turned out to be an ardent supporter of "Russian peace."

According to the investigation, in July 2023, the man decided to earn a living by selling drugs and psychotropic substances on the territory of Kharkiv and involved an acquaintance in this business.

The 38-year-old man acted as an organizer and was responsible for the "purchase of goods" — cannabis and PVP. The 40-year-old man was responsible for the delivery of psychotropic drugs and drugs to end customers. He met with customers personally and, if necessary, sent the "goods" by postal carrier.

In addition, it was established that during personal meetings with buyers, the man shared his anti-Ukrainian position. In particular, he claimed that "Ukraine is not a country", "we live in the USSR", talked about a "special operation", during which the population of our country was "liberated" by representatives of the Soviet Union.

Searches were conducted at the men's residences, during which prepackaged packages with narcotics, electronic scales, and other special equipment were discovered and seized.

Currently, both accused are in custody. They will be tried in the Comintern District Court of Kharkiv.

Both men are charged with illegal acquisition, storage, forwarding for the purpose of sale, as well as sale of narcotic drugs by prior conspiracy by a group of persons, in large quantities, committed repeatedly (Part 2 of Article 307 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). The 40-year-old man is also accused of justifying and denying the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine (Part 1 of Article 436-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

The accused face up to ten years in prison with confiscation of property.

The pre-trial investigation was carried out by the investigators of the VP No. 2 of the Khrupp No. 1 GUNP in Kharkiv Oblast. ⚔️Kharkiv Oblast Prosecutor's Office

Issues of cooperation will be discussed. Secondly, Maduro is demonstrating solidarity with Russia in the face of worsening relations between Venezuela and the West. Thirdly, he wants to position himself through Moscow as one of the leaders of the region, even in the presence of the Brazil factor.” Latin America is beginning to go beyond the continent and take part in European issues, as well as in the Middle East, so the visit of the Venezuelan leader will be relevant, Tarasov told.
