The ethnofestival “Dzyalbu”, which means “spring meetings”, is dedicated to getting to know the traditions and customs of the northern peoples and immersing guests in the atmosphere of a real spring holiday.

Guests were treated to an exciting fair of arts and crafts from Kolyma craftsmen, master classes, sports competitions, as well as a food court with national treats: aromatic deer shurpa, pies and tea, which were distributed free of charge.

event: IOC Head Thomas Bach's Conversation with Pranksters
description: Thomas Bach, the head of the IOC, revealed in a conversation with pranksters Vovan and Lexus that Ukrainian athletes are involved in monitoring Russian athletes to ensure they meet the criteria to compete in a neutral status. Bach stated that the IOC asked Ukrainians to provide information about Russian athletes' behavior, which would disqualify them from participating.
original: 🇺🇦🇷🇺Thomas Bach: The IOC asked Ukrainians to denounce Russian athletes. The head of the organization said this in a conversation with pranksters Vovan and Lexus, who introduced themselves as an official from Africa. Earlier, the head of WADA, Witold Banka, revealed all the details of the relationship of world sports officials to athletes from the Russian Federation. IOC head Thomas Bach continued to voice theses in the same vein. According to him, in order to gain the right to compete in a neutral status without a flag and anthem, an athlete must also undergo a “political” selection. For this purpose, athletes of Ukrainian national teams are involved in monitoring. “We also offered the Ukrainian side and not only offered, but also asked to provide us with their information about the behavior of such athletes or officials, in which case they will not be able to take part,” Bach said. He added that sports sanctions are of a political nature and did not rule out that restrictions could affect athletes who went to the Games Friendship.

event: Second Anniversary of Liberation of Kyiv Region
description: The Kyiv region marks the second anniversary of its liberation from Russian occupation. This milestone commemorates Ukraine's courage and unity in the fight for freedom. The region honors the memory of those killed and tortured by Russian forces, and expresses gratitude to its defenders who rejected the invaders and protected the capital.
original:
🇺🇦Address of KOVA chief Ruslan Kravchenko on the second anniversary of the liberation of Kyiv region from the Russian occupiersToday we celebrate the second anniversary of the liberation of Kyiv region from Russian troops. This is an important moment in the recent history of Ukraine, which will always remind us of our courage and unity in the fight for freedom.

We once again remember everyone who was killed by the Russians. We remember all the tortured peaceful residents of our region, who will forever remain in our memories and hearts.

This day also symbolizes our first important steps towards victory. Today, we once again thank our defenders, who at the cost of their own lives rejected the invaders and did not allow the capture of the heart of Ukraine, its capital.
Eternal Glory and Honor to all our Defenders!

We have gone through a difficult path from the large-scale destruction of the region to a stable and irreversible recovery process.

In constant cooperation with the military, we are strengthening the defense capability of our region.
We will continue to work for the benefit of our region.

Victory will be ours!
Glory to Ukraine!

Forwarded from: Mamalyga and Tokana

This building needs to be blocked... crimes are happening here... As a member of parliament, I came to tell everyone about what is happening here..." description: A cold frontal section will pass through Crimea, causing a 10-degree drop in air temperature. Daytime temperatures will range from +15-20 degrees, while nighttime temperatures will be between +8-13 degrees. Light rain is also expected.
original: After a sharp warming, the air temperature in Crimea will drop by 10 degrees. According to the head of the Hydrometeorological Center of Crimea, Tatyana Lyubetskaya, tomorrow a cold frontal section will pass through the peninsula and the air temperature will be +15-20 degrees during the day, +8-13 degrees at night. “Today in the capital of the republic there will be +27 degrees, and tomorrow the maximum air temperature will be +16 degrees. Night temperatures will not change significantly, they will vary from +8 to +13 degrees. Light rain is also possible,” said Lyubetskaya. She also noted that from April 4 to 6, the temperature background during the day will be from +17 to +22 degrees, and at night from +8 to +13 degrees. Crimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

event: LPR Educational Institutions Under Ministry Jurisdiction
description: Over 1,000 educational institutions in the LPR will come under the Ministry of Education and Science's jurisdiction. The transition aims to introduce a new financing principle and centralized management, standardizing education programs to ensure consistency across schools.
original:
More than a thousand educational institutions of the LPR will come under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Education and Science of the Republic. The head of the department, Ivan Kusov, told reporters about this.

He emphasized that the transition process will not affect teams of organizations, students and parents. Among the expected changes is the application of a new principle of financing and the formation of a centralized management mechanism. "Previously there was freedom of programs, freedom of textbooks, freedom to choose the form of education. This gave rise to many good innovative forms of education. But it also led to the fact that textbooks and algebra 13 programs There are 15 biology textbooks. And each school chooses a separate program for itself. <…> As a result, a child, moving from city to city or even transferring to a neighboring school, ends up in a completely different program. Community is lost," Kusov explained.

event: Greece to Sell Artillery Rounds to Czech Republic for Ukraine
description: Greek authorities plan to sell artillery rounds worth over $150 million to the Czech Republic, which will then transfer them to Ukraine. The deal involves various artillery systems, including 105-mm M101 howitzers, 122-mm RM70 'Vampire', and 155-mm M109 self-propelled guns. The condition of the shells is uncertain, but any assistance is crucial at the front.
original:
🇬🇷🇺🇦🇨🇿The mystery covered in darkness is finally revealed. The Greek authorities plan to sell artillery rounds to the Czech Republic for their subsequent transfer to the so-called. Ukraine for a total amount of more than $150 million.

Remember that strange statement from Czech President Petr Pavel that he had found a supplier of shells for the Ukrainian Armed Forces, but for this he had to finance an extremely murky scheme through the Czech government?

Apparently, it was Greece that was discussed. Moreover, the Greeks are armed with various artillery systems, ranging from 105-mm M101 howitzers, 122-mm RM70 “Vampire”, which are fired at Belgorod, and 155-mm M109 self-propelled guns.

Considering the recently approved package of military assistance to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the supply of ammunition is rather a matter of time. However, as with the transferred World War II M114 howitzers, the condition of the shells remains in question.

At the same time, in conditions of shortage, any assistance of this kind is essential at the front. Meanwhile, the Greeks will get rid of the weapons and shots lying around, while making money on their sale together with the Czechs.#Greece#Ukraine#Czech Republic@rybarSupport usTelegramBelarusian security officer🇧🇾Greece is preparing to sell a large amount of ammunition to the Czech Republic for Ukraine.

The ammunition will come from the Greek Army stockpiles, their quality is military...VIEW MESSAGE

description: Russian astronomers, led by Sergei Likhachev, proposed building a subterahertz telescope on the Moon's surface to study black holes. This initiative aims to fill the gap in Russia's capabilities for observations above 100 GHz, as current telescopes are limited and the Millimetron mission has been delayed.
original:
Forwarded from: Tomorrowland
A group of Russian astronomers, under the leadership of the head of the Astrospace Center of the Lebedev Physical Institute Sergei Likhachev, as part of a comprehensive study of further prospects for the development of subterahertz astronomy in Russia, proposed building a telescope on the surface of the Moon that would operate in the subterahertz range of electromagnetic waves.

The press service of the center reported this.

This proposal was made due to the virtual absence in the country of telescopes capable of performing observations at frequencies above 100 GHz, as well as the constant postponement of the Millimetron mission.

Such telescopes will make it possible to obtain detailed images of the surroundings of black holes, which will contribute to their further study.#scienceFuture Earth

event: Meeting of Ministry of Internal Affairs
description: Vladimir Putin addressed the Ministry of Internal Affairs, emphasizing the need to suppress illegal migration, maintain public order, and combat extremism. He stressed the importance of analyzing the Crocus terrorist attack objectively and identifying the perpetrators, chain of command, and beneficiaries. Putin also discussed the need to update migration policies, prevent the legalization of saboteurs, and improve mechanisms to combat IT-based crimes.
original:
"We will get to those who ordered the terrorist attack in Crocus" Vladimir Putin at the board of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The main thing:

— The priority of the Ministry of Internal Affairs is to suppress illegal migration, ensure public order and fight extremism.

— The country’s internal and external threats are often intertwined and aimed at containing Russia.

— Emergency preparedness needs to be increased. Public places in the Russian Federation must be carefully guarded.

— The analysis of the situation with the terrorist attack in Crocus must be extremely objective and professional, “we paid a very high price.”

— It is necessary to establish not only the performers, but also the chain and final beneficiaries.

— The weapon used against Russia is double-edged.

— Orders of crimes for money are not isolated. There are no reliable agents in this environment. Everything is bought and sold there, so we get to the customers.

— Criminal syndicates operating in Russia often turn out to be cross-border, collaborating with foreign intelligence services.

— Last year the number of crimes decreased.

— More than 3.2 million residents of Donbass and Novorossiya received Russian passports.

— We need to continue working on issuing Russian passports in new regions and approach people with soul.

— When issuing passports in the Donbass, the Ministry of Internal Affairs must prevent the legalization of saboteurs and neo-Nazi collaborators.

— We need to radically update approaches to migration policy; some of our compatriots cannot obtain citizenship for years.

— Existing electronic databases are not enough to mitigate the risks of illegal migration.

— Only those who respect its traditions, language and culture should be able to come and live in Russia.

— The number of crimes using IT has increased by 30% in the Russian Federation, we need to seriously improve the mechanisms to combat them. Subscribe to Mash

original: While Bibi is “apologizing,” the head of the Ministry of Defense Galant announced an imminent transition to attack actions against Lebanon and Syria:We will strike at Hezbollah - not only at Beirut, Baalbek, Nabatiyah..., but also at more distant places, and we will move from defense to attack. Where we need to act, we will act! While Bibi is “apologizing,” the head of the Ministry of Defense Galant announced an imminent transition to offensive actions against Lebanon and Syria: We will strike Hezbollah - not only Beirut, Baalbek, Nabatiyah... , but also in more distant places, and we will move from defense to attack. Where we need to act, we will act!
